h1.span: Open and Search the Knowledge Base

div.p: Navigate to the Knowledge Base and use the search options to find articles.
There are multiple search options to narrow searches in the Knowledge Base.
div.div:
Search: Enter search terms here.
Status: Use the dropdown menu to search by status.
Default is set to Approved
You can use the checkboxes to search by one or more statuses. Figure 2. View of the status checkboxes
Category: Start typing or use the Lookup Category option
Always Search by Both.
Public does not mean published to the IT website (it.umn.edu).
Include the Include Subcategoriescheckbox if you want to include articles intended for a specific audience in your search results.
Owner: Start typing a person's name or a Group name.
You can also use the Lookup Owner option if needed.
The Assignment Lookup window will open with options for filtering.
You can leave all the filter options as is to search for Groups.
Review Date: Enter From , To, or both dates.
Published, Unpublished, or Both:Choose from the radio button options
Default is Both.
Select Published to limit your search to articles published to the IT website (it.umn.edu).
Public, Not Public, or Both: Choose from the radio button options.
Leave this options as the default Both.
Public articles are viewable in the Client Portal with no login. None of our articles should be marked Public.
Created Date: Enter From, To,or both dates. Figure 3. A sample of filled out search options

div.p: Find the Knowledge Base through the Applications menu.

li.span: Click the Applications menu
Select Client Portal if necessary
Click Knowledge Base in the menu bar.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

h1.span: Create a New Knowledge Base Article

div.p: Follow these steps to create a new Knowledge Base article and change the ownership to the appropriate Group.

li.span: Navigate to the Knowledge Base.
li.div: For guidance, visit Navigate to the Knowledge Base (on page ).

li.span: Verify your intended new article is not already covered in the Knowledge Base.
li.div: For guidance, visit Search for Duplicate Articles (on page )for guidance.

li.span: If there is no duplicate article, click +New Article.

div.em: The New Article form will appear.

li.span: Enter the article Category.
li.div: See TDX Knowledge: Assign a Category/Subcategory to the Knowledge Article.

img.alt: A screenshot of the Knowledge Base Category Lookup.
img.css:oxy-alt-text: A screenshot of the Knowledge Base Category Lookup.

li.div: Click the Lookup Category icon to do a search of categories.
DO NOT change the Order field.
DO NOT click the Pin Article checkbox.

li.span: Enter the Subject (article title).
Enter article content in the Body field.
li.div: Visit Enter Body Field Article Content (on page )for guidance
DO NOT include the title for the article in the Body field.
Do include a summary to provide context for what follows. This can be a single sentence.
Format the article as needed following our standards. Visit Format for Internal and Public-Facing Articles (on page ) for guidance.

li.span: Enter an Article Summary.
li.div: Use under 100 characters if possible
Visit List of Article Types (on page ) for reference.

li.span: Enter any Tags.
li.div: Tags allow users to search for the aritcle by keywords.
Enter a tag for the technology referred to in the article. For example, "Canvas", "Salesforce".
New tag names may only contain alpha-numeric characters or hyphens with no spaces.
You can enter any number of tags.

span.em: If you are a Group Editor, follow these instructions:

li.span: Set Status to Not Submitted.

span.em: If you are a Global Editor, follow these instructions:

li.span: Set Status to Not Submitted.
Change Owner to the appropriate Group
Check Notify Owner on Feedback.
(optional) Enter Knowledge Internal Notes.
li.div: Use this field to enter any information a technician might need to support a customer when the article is published to it.umn.edu.

li.span: Select the appropriate response to the prompt "Should the viewing of this content be limited to the University community?"
Click Save.

img.alt: A screenshot of the View Mode.
img.css:oxy-alt-text: A screenshot of the View Mode.

span.em: Global Editors, change the Owner from yourself to the appropriate Group.

li.span: Click Edit Article.
Change the Owner to the appropriate Group if needed.
li.div: If you are a Group Knowledge Editor or a technician, and you change an article to a group you are not a member of, you will no longer be able to edit the article after changing the Owner.
Everyone in the Group will be able to edit Not Submitted articles owned by the Group.
Group Editors will be able to edit, approve or reject, and archive all articles owned by the Group.

div.p: Before creating a new Knowledge Base article, you need to verify the article is not already covered in the Knowledge Base.

li.span: Sign in to TDX and select Client Portal.
If you are already signed into TDX, click the Applications menuand select Client Portal.
Click Knowledge Base in the menu bar.
Click Search in the menu bar.

div.em: The Search page will appear with multiple search options.

li.div: By default, the Status filter is set to Approved.

li.span: Choose your search option(s).
li.div: Visit Knowledge Base search options reference file for more.

li.span: Click Search.

div.em: A list of articles that meet your search criteria will appear below the Search options.

li.div: Search results are limited to 300.

li.span: Click the link to any article that could cover what your new article would cover
Review the article to verify it does not cover what your new article would cover.
Repeat the search as necessary to ensure your new article is not already covered in the Knowledge Base.
li.div: You may need to try several searches with different keywords and search options.

h2.span: Enter article content into the Body field

div.p: Follow this guide to summarize the article.

li.span: Write a summary of the content.
li.div: This can be a single sentence.
DO NOT included the article title in the Body field. This will cause the title to appear twice.

li.span: Use headings for proper article structure.
Follow our article formatting standards.
li.div: Visit Format Internal and Public-Facing Articles (on page ) for guidance.

div.p: This checklist is for Knowledge Editors to use when formatting an internal or public article following our standards.

li.p: Format topic and subtopic titles as headings.
Reference application interface terms just as they appear in the interface.
Give topics and subtopics a logical sequence.
Format topic and subtopic titles as not-bold headings.
Use "ing" verbs when describing a process within the article content.

div.p: Follow this reference to determine what to write in the article summary based on its article type.

tr.th: What to include in the Article Summary

tr.td: List the group(s) which support the department.
Published Articles (articles that will be public-facing)
Copy the first sentence of the article.
Include a short statement that clarifies the title, if necessary.

div.p: Follow this guidance when entering article content in the Body field.

li.p: DO NOT include the title for the article in the Body field. This will cause the title to appear twice.

ul.li: DO include a brief summary to provide context for what follows. This can be a single sentence.

li.p: Use headings for proper article structure.
If your article was drafted in Google Docs, remove the extra HTML formatting before pasting in your content.

h1.span: TDX Knowledge Base Display and Linking

div.p: Understand how TDX knowledge base articles are displayed and linked on the Technology Help (IT) website.
Understand how TDX knowledge base articles are displayed on the Technology Help (IT) website.

ul.li:
Internal articles can only be viewed in TDX.
Exception: If an article is marked Public (which no article should be), anyone with the link can view it in TDX.
Published articles can be viewed in TDX or on the Technology Help (IT) website.

Published articles are pulled into Drupal nightly:
Central Standard Time (CST): 5:00 PM
Fall/Winter is January-March and November-December
Central Daylight Time (CDT): 6:00 PM
Spring/Summer is March-November

Once a new public article has been pulled into Drupal, it will have a Drupal-generated URL based on the article's title.
Once pulled, you can find it using the Self Help Search for on the Technology Help website, it.umn.edu.
In general, new knowledge will be available no later than 6:00 AM the next morning.
If there is an emergency need for information to be available sooner, fill out a Service Lifecycle Support equest via z.umn.edu/makeituserfriendly form.

h2.span: How Linking Works Between TDX and Drupal

div.p: Understand how TDX knowledge base articles are linked on the Technology Help (IT) website.

ul.li: Links from one article to another must use the TDX link whether an article is for internal use or is public-facing (Published).

li.p: If a published article contains a link to another published article, Drupal will automatically substitute the TDX article link with the Drupal-generated URL.
When an article title changes, Drupal updates the Drupal-generated URL.
All changes to articles must be made in TDX.
Most knowledge editors cannot edit KB articles directly on the Drupal website.
If there is an urgent need to have an article updated, fill out a request via z.umn.edu/makeituserfriendly form.
Links from an IT web page to a public article must use the article's Drupal-generated URL, not its TDX link.

ul.li:
There is a pull limit of 50 public-facing articles per day into Drupal.
The limit is for any articles that had changes made (including both newly Published articles and articles with any updates or changes).
The limit is in the pull from the headless Drupal site to the production Drupal site. There is no limit in the pull from TDX to the headless Drupal site.
The limit is 50 per day and does not roll over to the next day.
Example: If you publish/update 60 Published articles in one day, then 50 articles will update in Drupal that night and the extra 10 articles will not update in Drupal. To get those extra articles to pull into Drupal, go into TDX the next day and either un-Publish/re-Publish them or make an edit so they can be part of the 50 for the new day.
If you are working on a large Knowledge maintenance project and are updating/publishing 50+ public-facing KB articles in one day, it is recommended to limit those updates to 40 public-facing articles per day. This leaves 10 extra slots in the knowledge pull for any general operational KB article updates.
Note: If you don't see a TDX ID number at the bottom of an Technology Help web page, the page was created in Drupal, not TDX.
All KB articles are How-To articles on the Technology Help website (it.umn.edu).

div.p: These nested topics are for users who create or edit content on the Technology Help website.
Create and publish a service page.

li.span: Sign in to the Drupal website
In the top menu, hover over Content then Add content then Service
Fill in the content
Add a note to the Revision log message on the right side of the page

ul.li: Briefly describe what you did to the page

li.span: To publish the page, check the box next to Published and Save

ul.li: To save the page as a draft to publish later, leave the box unchecked and Save

div.p: How to create a news article

li.span: Sign in to the Drupal website
In the top menu, hover over Content then Add content then News
Confirm that in the Site Section drop-down menu, News is selected
Confirm Published Date is correct
li.div: If you are updating an article, use the Updated Date field

li.span: Fill in the content below
Add a note to the Revision log message on the right side of the page
li.div: Briefly describe what you did to the page

li.span: Select Promotion Options on the right side of the page
Check the box next to Promoted to front page to ensure the article appears on the home page of the Tech Help website
To publish the article, check the box next to Published and Save
li.div: To save the article as a draft to publish later, leave the box unchecked and Save

div.p: Lists of editing permissions by different role types.

tr.td: Create and edit any pages you have access to

div.div: Note: This role will not be able to publish new pages. They can only save them as drafts. They will need to have someone with the Page Publisher role review and publish their pages.

tr.td: Publish and unpublish any pages you have access to
Create, edit and publish pages using the specialized content types (except Knowledge Base Article)
Create and edit single-use custom blocks
Define the existing Paragraph types and their fields and behaviors
Administer Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
Administer Rabbit Hole settings for Content & Taxonomy terms
Add and remove access to platforms
